result.name: 16-to-19-bursary-fund-annual-mi-return
result.notes: The 16-19 Bursary Funding annual data return is a voluntary collection from institutions with an allocation of funding.  The aim is to obtain data on the numbers of students supported in each of the Bursary Fund's defined vulnerable group categories; the number supported with discretionary bursary awards and the amount of funding spent on vulnerable group bursaries. The collection is undertaken once a year in October.  It is collected directly by the EFA.  From 2013/14, institutions will only be asked for data on discretionary bursary awards.  Data on vulnerable group bursaries will be supplied to the EFA by the Learner Support Service (LSS), following a change in the arrangements by which institutions draw down funding for these students from this year.

organization.name: education-funding-agency
organization.title: Education and Skills Funding Agency
organization.description:
The ESFA brings together the former responsibilities of the Education Funding Agency (EFA) and Skills Funding Agency (SFA) to create a single agency accountable for funding education and skills for children, young people and adults.

ESFA is an executive agency, sponsored by the Department for Education.

result.title: 16 to 19 Bursary Fund annual MI return.

extras.value: The data is not published in its raw form.  However, a range of aggregate outputs are published in the reports of the on-going evaluation of the 16-19 Bursary Fund.
